title: 103_hr5098
content: The Act titled "Fort Peck Tribes- Montana Compact Act of 1994" is ratified and confirmed, approving agreements related to the use of water rights. The Fort Peck Indian Tribes may enter into Water Agreements for the delivery, use, or transfer of water rights confirmed in the Tribes by the Fort Peck Indian Tribes-Montana Compact, for a specified term not exceeding 50 years. The Fort Peck Indian Tribes may enter into Water Agreements for the diversion or use of tribal water rights within or outside the Reservation. The Secretary must approve or disapprove a Water Agreement within 180 days of submission or 60 days after compliance with relevant laws. The Fort Peck Indian Tribes can enter Water Agreements for tribal water rights, subject to approval within 180 days. Enforcement can be done in accordance with federal law, and confidentiality of related information is ensured by the Department of the Interior. The Fort Peck Indian Tribes can enter Water Agreements for tribal water rights, subject to approval within 180 days. The control of terms and conditions, financial benefits, and confidentiality of information related to Water Agreements is protected. The Tribes are restricted from authorizing the use of tribal water rights outside the Basin. Economic development provisions are established in the Treasury. The "Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes Economic Recovery Fund" is established in the Treasury, with 10% of receipts from integrated programs deposited annually starting in fiscal year 1996. The Western Area Power Administration administers a fund with a maximum limit of $50,000,000. The interest accrued on deposits is deposited in a separate account for the Secretary of the Interior to make payments to Tribes for economic development purposes. The fund administered by the Western Area Power Administration has a maximum limit of $50,000,000. Payments to Tribes for economic development, including long-term profit-making opportunities and employment, and for land acquisition within the Reservation are nonreimbursable and nonreturnable. No reduction in Federal services or programs for Tribes will result from these payments. No payments under this Act will reduce or deny Federal services or programs for Tribes. Payments will not be subject to income tax or affect power rates. Funds will not be distributed on a per capita basis to Tribe members. The United States waives claims in exchange for fulfilling obligations. In exchange for the United States fulfilling obligations under this Act, including funding the Fund, the Tribes waive any claims related to water rights settled by the Fort Peck Indian Tribes-Montana Compact. SEC. 4. DEFINITIONS. The "Fort Peck Indian Tribes-Montana Compact" refers to a water rights agreement ratified in 1985. The "Reservation" is the Fort Peck Indian Reservation defined in historical agreements. The "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Interior. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Interior, while the term "Tribes" specifically means the Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes of the Fort Peck Indian Reservation. Additionally, the term "tribal water right" is defined in the Fort Peck-Montana Compact, and the "Fund" refers to the Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes Economic Recovery Fund.
